website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the line model by one of the most trusted names in lawn equipment. Hands down the best available on the market.
pros: A lightweight, 2-in-1 tool that weeds and edges
Lithium-powered battery holds a long charge
cons: Not quite as powerful as gas-powered models

website_summaries.verdict: This model includes the run time and auto-feed features of other BLACK+DECKER units, but its extended battery life and extra power make it a good option for users with larger lawns or heavy growth spots.
pros: The 3 amp-hour battery is the largest BLACK+DECKER offers, and the additional run time means users who need to cover a lot of ground can finish the job without running out of battery
The larger battery also gives the LSTE523 a little more power, allowing it to cut through areas of thick growth that might cause some models to jam
The 6.3 pound weight is easy to maneuver
cons: While this unit has the power for them, the automatic line feed may have trouble keeping up with particularly heavy jobs, making manual feed more practical in those situations

customer_reviews.title: Ladies you got to get one.
customer_reviews.text: Ladies this weed eater is so easy. You don't have to bother anyone to trim your grass. You can go and weedeat around your house and around your flowers. Just push the button and away to go. It's so easy like 1,2 ,3, and it is just the right weight. I should of bought one years ago. I weed everything I wanted to with one charge. Here is some pics to show you how easy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Great design and function but cheap materials doom this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Put this trimmer together, charged the battery and started trimming. Absolutely loved the auto string feed, light weight and wheel for edging. Was finishing up in record time barely breaking a sweat when the guard flew off 10’ from the finish. When I picked up the guard the attachment screw was still in place. Turned the trimmer over and saw the place where the guard attached had cracked open. Great design and function but cheap plastic materials spelled doom for this product on its first use. Too bad, returned the same day it was delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt B

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be any easier to use. Edging and weedwacking made easy. Had plenty of power to take care of my weeds and did a superb job edging an overgrown lawn that hadn't been edged in years. Used it to clean up weeds in the cracks of the driveway as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael shaf

customer_reviews.title: A great paperweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete piece of crap. The "easy feed" spools out string continuously, instead of when needed. This triggers a safety mechanism, which shuts the thing off. So basically, you can only use it if you stop every 5-10 seconds to trim the line or push the string back in.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Berg

customer_reviews.title: Product broken, bad reviews are probably oppressed somehow
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived broken straight out of the box, feeder would endlessly feed more line making it impossible/dangerous to use, and there are several others who complained about this issue on other websites as well...
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Learn from my mistake: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Motor started smoking after first 15 minutes of use. Called Black and Decker to issue a refund and they wanted me to bring it to a service center 20 + minutes away. They would not pay for shipping to the service center. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The Battery Is The Highlight Of This Trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer has only two good features. The battery lasts a long time, and two speed motor is good to have. The auto line feeder does not work, and when you use the feed button on the trimmer, it stops the trimmer. It also releases too much string. I turn the trimmer over, and pull the string out by hand!. Whether you the pre-wound spools, or wind your on, the line keeps jamming! AT least once every use, I have to take the string cover off, and unjam the string! My first Black and Decker trimmer was great - lasted years - until the string spool cover broke. This "new and improved" model is junk - except for the battery!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two units failed. If you buy this, be sure to buy the warranty......you'll need it.....
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit that I bought. The first lasted about a year. I didn't have a warranty, and needed a replacement, so I bought the same model again, with extra batteries and this time with a warranty. I should have known better......this new one lasted less than 2 months. The string won't feed at all.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Does great job. BUT battery time and replacement troublesome
customer_reviews.text: BLACK+DECKER LSTE523 20V Max Lithium trimmer/mower does great job. BUT battery time and replacement are troublesome. I didn't give 5 stars to this product for 3 reasons. 1. Battery run-time is 15-20 mins with high power (setting 2). Most probably settting 1 would add extra 5-10 minutes to that but not powerful enough. 2. You definitely need backup battery in order to continue working on your medium size yard (LB2X3020) which is very hard to find and expensive ($59.99 on amazon 7/14/18) ans has no generic version like other models that you can find for a fraction of original cost. 3. Power switch has no "lock" option and it's so tiring to hold it for 15-20 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 4 months ago and now it is not working. I am very unhappy with this product right now. I called customer support and they asked me to send it to a repair center. Thus, i have no equipment while the device is in transit and while it is being repaired. I will update my review if i have a positive outcome. Otherwise, i will not buy and recommend any other black and decker product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for my electric trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Sears electric trimmer. I threw it away after the cord kept tangling. I got this unit with the more powerful battery instead of the two less powerful batteries. I use it for light trimming around the fence line of my 5000 square foot yard and along the driveway. I am able to complete my trimming on one charge. Use it at the higher speed. The lower speed is not powerful enough. Line feed works well. Highly recommend! ☺ .
customer_reviews.author: T. Soptick

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked for about 5 seconds then fell apart. Returned it immediately. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: AldenRick

customer_reviews.title: Line doesn't feed.
customer_reviews.text: Trimming takes 1/3 longer because the line won't feed when I push the ever so handy button near the trigger when I need more line. I have to stop, turn the thing over, pop open the spool, feed the line by hand and repeat again in a few minutes when I need more line again. I thought the bump feed was annoying but at least that worked occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: F. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this. It will break. Mine stopped working after about two months of use once a week. Battery charges but it will not run. Listen to other one star reviews and heed their warnings. I wish I had. This was a very expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gordy

customer_reviews.title: Works for less than 10 sec then STOPS
customer_reviews.text: I used this trimmer twice. First time it worked well. Then I charged the battery (the green light never flashed constant as an indication for full charge as stated on the battery after charging for hours. It would flash rapidly) When I inserted battery into trimmer and start it, it would work for less and 10 sec then stop. If I start again it would work for less than 5 secs each time.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sams

customer_reviews.title: Great product, features, battery-life, and power
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about power, battery life, and edging. I got the single larger battery. It exceeded all my expectations. A single battery trimmed my entire .42 acre yard, AND edged my driveway and sidewalk. If you have not done much edging before, it may not make it through it all the first time. It does not spin at the same rate as my previous gas trimmer, but it works even better because it is much easier to control. It does go through line, but I suspect replacement line will fix that.
customer_reviews.author: B. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Died third time using...
customer_reviews.text: Motor is dead for no understandable reason. I am super frustrated with this. I will have to contact B&D and I'm sure it will be a super hassle. Up until this happened, I sorta liked the trimmer...much lighter than gas trimmer, but holding the trigger on this one all the time really hurt my wrist. I was able to use trimmer for only 15 minutes at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Rynni

customer_reviews.title: Love this Lighweight Weed Wacker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this weed wacker to replace my 4-cycle gas powered wacker which was way to heavy for me to use. This cordless weed wacker has met all of my expectations. It's so light that I was able to trim my entire 3/4 acre yard which has a lot of edging to do. The battery lasted slight less than I though it would, but that wasn't a problem since I bought an additional battery and had it charged and ready to go. It was easy to use and the feed button made releasing the string when needed very effortlessly. I would definitely recommend this wacker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long Battery Use
customer_reviews.text: Used today for the first time. I'm impressed! I am a real critic when it comes to products like this and it passed my test. Battery time means everything to me and it worked well for long use. I edged my driveway too which takes more battery usage because of dirt. Biggest bang for my buck in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Apollo97

customer_reviews.title: 1year and8 month Weedeater
customer_reviews.text: Bought in August 2017, it broke in April 28, 2019, the gear that turns spool on trimmer, broke ,can hear it turning but spool doesn’t turn. So if you are ok with it lasting 1 year and 8 months this weed eater is for you. Used on my small yard, which was edging sidewalk and cutting weeds along house and fence.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kin

customer_reviews.title: Junk & waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased Last year beginning of summer of 2018 use once this year May 2019 interior looking mechanism broke. Also Black & Decker makes its money off the twine which you’ll always be messing with & buying at a high cost! He’d my warning this is absolute junk!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for the 3 times it actually worked, 4th time with fully charged battery weedeater wouldn't start, nothing. Luckily I had 2 day left of the return policy, it was shipped back today. This afternoon I decided to spend an extra $30 and bought a 2 cycle stihl. I do not recommend. At least it broke before the 30 days were up. If you do buy this, be sure to keep the original shipping boxes, I had not kept the black and decker box but luckily had the outside larger box still.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Gebo

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and it didn't work. Returned, replaced with same item. I've had it for 11 months and have used it maybe eight times. It stopped working today and no trouble shooting will help. What junk.
customer_reviews.author: JMEllis

customer_reviews.title: Well done! except for the guard did NOT want to snap into place
customer_reviews.text: Well done Black and Decker! BLACK+DECKER LSTE525. Pro's: The manual has impressive detail, like this company has really thought through designing and using a string trimmer. It works great, especially the edger, I am impressed. Con's: I received it and could NOT get the guard to snap in place. I asked B+D for support from their webpage, they did not answer. I returned the unit to Amazon (not much fun to pack it all up) and got a replacement. I WAS able to snap that guard in, but only 99% of the way, not 100% - but it works. So points off for the lousy fit of the guard.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Cottingham

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer worked fine for a couple of months and then died - totally. B&D is sending a shipping label so I can send it to a repair station somewhere for repair, but I have to find a box (and pay for). My advice to you is DON'T BUY THIS THING!
customer_reviews.author: f4stick

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of battery life to trim my whole yard
customer_reviews.text: This was my first battery powered trimmer after getting sick of constantly tuning carbs, filling up gas cans, and mixing in oil. I can definitely say I'll never go back. I was worried that it wouldn't be powerful enough to trim everything, but this thing has got plenty of power and juice to spare. The only slight issue I've had so far is that the adjustable handle that you grab on to occasionally pops up a notch causing me to have to stop and readjust it, but I think I'm just putting too much force on it. This thing is so light its easy to toss around. So long gas!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Overstreet

customer_reviews.title: The trimmer has great power and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Black and Decker Products are good quality and affordable. I've owned them for years. The trimmer has great power and battery life. It is not too heavy either. Why am I giving it 3 stars? I've given it just three stars because as an edger it is barely acceptable. It seems that the string is too far from the grass when I edge with it. I took off the wheel and the arm that supports the wheel. This did improve it a bit. This is very convenient, much more so than having to move around with an electric cord trailing you.
customer_reviews.author: Man in the West

customer_reviews.title: Ended up making a great gift
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this to my husband for fathers day. At first he wasn't excited about getting something that was used to do more work with hahaha but I needed help with the garden and yard work and thought if he had a cool gadget of his own it would encourage him to do more yard work. Well...it worked! and now I can't stop him from wanting to trim, edge or weed whack. I don't even ask him anymore to do the work. He just does it because he now enjoys it and takes pride in the work he has done. It is easy to use, battery lasts a good while and simply just gets the job done right.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical of a battery operated weed wacker but was happy with the product. Right out of the box the battery had more then enough power to go around my house and property in the higher power mode. It’s light weight and has an adjustable length and handle which makes it great if I ask my kid to help with the lawn. It’s not as fast or loud as an gas powered one but has plenty of power to cut down weeds.
customer_reviews.author: SP2727

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this after one use. I’ve used a battery powered Black and Decker weed wacker for over 5 years. It gave up last week and I did my research and liked the reviews for this one. Compared to the old one it feels cheap and flimsy. I doubt it would last long. It’s also quite underpowered. If you have a small garden and don’t use it much then it might work for you. Pros. Lightweight. Easy to use. Cons. Delicate. Underpowered. I’ve found my old one still on sale and bought that.
customer_reviews.author: David Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak to logevity yet, as I've only used it once. That said, I'm a 60-year-old single woman who found this easy to use. It's lightweight, instructions are intuitive and it does the job. It has safety features that make it shut off automatically when you release the trigger, which can be a little frustrating at times, but safety is important. Battery lasted through the entire job. String advance button working fine. Absolutely no issues. I will come back and edit if it doesn't hold up well, but so far I'm totally thrilled with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: PrintingChick

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm.... My redneck friends may laugh at battery powered tools, but as someone who would rather not do small engine repair on the weekends... I have an acre in rural VA. We have a big wraparound driveway. I was able to edge the entire driveway quickly and easily. One battery charge and roughly an hour's work. Nice power to cut through whatever that weed killer resistant super creeper grass is, and enough battery life to handle an acre. I was thinking I'd have to do this over two days with a battery charge in between. Nope, tackled my driveway with juice left over to cut down the stuff around the AC unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Maggard

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: $20 cheaper than getting it at a home improvement store. Shipped fast. Bring cordless is a big plus. 2 power settings is also a plus but can get caught/entwined if you try to cut vines. The line feeder is a big plus also as it helps you gauge if your still cutting or edging. I had an old weed watcher that I had to take off the spoil and feed the line through every time it’s short: very annoying. Battery life is enough for my yard but could use an extra one if your grass is crawling out of the edges for a while. Get an extra battery for bigger lawn work.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver O.

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars until the motor died
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until last weeding/trimming session when I noticed a burning smell coming from the motor. Figured I’d charge up both batteries and let it cool down. Pulled it out today and motor completely dead, not a sound. Both batteries completely charged and no obstruction in air vent or string mechanism. Have only had it since June, and use it maybe 2x month for 45 minutes. Mostly edging my front walk and moderately sized weeds out back. Bummed, now I need to figure out if I can get it replaced did not see any complaints about durability in many reviews?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Elliott

customer_reviews.title: 2 broke within 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this string trimmer kept breaking at the trigger handle. A crack started to form (inside) causing the trigger handle not to fully engage with the switch to power on the trimmer. I know the batteries are good because I have 3 separate batteries. I was able to hack the inside to get it to work for about 1 month longer and eventually the crack in the trigger handle got worse. This string trimmer was great, lightweight, pretty powerful but the design to the trigger has a flaw. I ended up going with the Husqvarna gas powered. All the money I spent (batteries, and 2 string trimmers) I could've just purchased the Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Franco

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I ever owned after 3 trimmers and 13 years. Used it for few months.
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned 1 electric battery and 2 gasoline powered weed trimmers in the past 13 years! All were piece of sh1t! I saw this online in YouTube and the guy says it works well but I wasn’t sure but the price was cheap and I’m low on money so bought one. Damn this thing works good! The charge with little battery is surprisingly plenty even on full mode. The best part is the line being fed properly and ease of cutting pesky grasses on the driveway. I don’t have to wear ear plugs either! Clean as hell with no more oil and gas mix! Highly recommend this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bruceyung70

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a year now. I wanted to wait to write a review. I absolutely love the ease and battery life of this trimmer! I have charged the battery 3 times in that year. I use it occasionally but for an hour at a time. I highly recommend it! It has been great from the first time I used it up until this last time when I ran out of line (which I’m ordering today).
customer_reviews.author: h3ath3r2

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: This unit lasted about 10 uses and I have a moderately sized yard. Bought it Sept 2018 died June 2019. I squeeze the trigger motor starts then suddenly dies. Could buy a new (and different brand) for the cost of getting this one repaired. Good power while it lasted and string feeding was easy and requires no bumping.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sells

customer_reviews.title: Good value, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good trimmer overall. It is a little under powered on the run time (battery saving) setting but pretty effective with the power setting. Have only used it once but battery life seems reasonably good. The handle does tend to slip and does not seem terribly sturdy. I like the wheel to flip it over and use it as an edger. Other reviews referenced the automatic line feed each time you turn it off and on. That did not bother me, I just kept it running pretty much the whole time. The trimmer line does seem pretty soft and I suspect I will go through it fairly quickly. Weight seems about average for a non–gas trimmer
customer_reviews.author: sle505

customer_reviews.title: Great lawn mower replacement for city dwellers
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had it long enough to judge the battery life... BUT everything else about this thing is amazing, it was nearly assembled when it came in the mail, took about 5 mins to put together without reading the instructions (I never learned how to read), has pretty good kick for a battery one although not quite on par with some corded ones or gas powered ones I've driven. It's lightweight and easy to lug around. Absolutely perfect for a lawn mower replacement if you live in the city and don't have much greenery to chop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because the smell of gas makes me SICK! No problem now, no gas smell, easy start and I dont have to fight with the string. I'm a 62 year old women and this is the best weed eater I've owned. Plus the battery gives out just about the same time I do....lol....so it forces me to take a break... I sometimes tend to over do myself.
customer_reviews.author: LOWRY

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Easy rotating head. Battery interchangeable with hedger trimmer. Replacement reels inexpensive. But plate with springs that ratchets the reel to feed line is inferior and failed within a few months. Used properly.
customer_reviews.author: A Likely Story

customer_reviews.title: Easy Feed should not be Auto Feed
customer_reviews.text: I have the LSTE523 and I am supposed to push the Easy-Feed button when I need to advance the trim line during operation. However, the line automatically come out each time I stop and restart the trimmer. This is definitely a design flaw and I see some other reviewers had the same issues. Too bad, this trimmer is otherwise light and easy to handle with enough juice for a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Captain West

customer_reviews.title: B&D Trimmer - So far, So good
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this trimmer 4-5 times, but so far, it's been great. One of its better features is its light weight, yet sturdy construction. This makes carrying, handling and operating it so much easier than my previous B&D Grass Hog. The plastic edging wheel looks gimmicky, but it actually works well to get a straight line along my sidewalk and driveway. Like others said, you won't get the same deep edge that a true edger edger provides, but my results weren't too far off. I also like the high / low power switch. I don't always need the extra juice, but when do, I choose power-lever 2. Stay well-trimmed my friends.
customer_reviews.author: 765 kV

customer_reviews.title: Nice little trimmer for my wife to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice little trimmer for my wife to use. If I had to do it over again, would have gotten one of the higher end models with more power and longer run time, but it does a very good job with edging sidewalks and light trimming. I may have optioned for the B&D LST 136W or Greenworks 21362 G-Max. The G-Max has a larger head and uses 0.80 line, plus for about $20 more you can get a 4ah battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than a year... no answer from customer service
customer_reviews.text: I used this trimmer to edge our sidewalk and trim around the garden. It worked fine last summer (purchased in May of 2018). I took it out this month to do a little edging and prep for spring, and it didn't work AT ALL. Dead. Nothing happened at all. The battery was fully charged, and worked just fine in my drill, but when I plugged it in to the trimmer, it did NOTHING. Even more disappointingly, I contacted Black & Decker, as the Amazon site directed me to do, and I have heard nothing back at all. Message was sent at the start of the week, and I have heard nothing back. Boo! One star.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S.

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I have a few B&D cordless products that I like (including drills, a chainsaw, etc) so for compatibility reasons thought I'd give this trimmer a try. I recently had my property re-landscaped and needed something to keep things looking neat and this has worked out great. This trimmer is light and easy to carry, but more importantly the battery lasts all the way around my 1/3 acre property with enough left over to do any remaining details after. I haven't hit end of life yet so can't comment on how long a charge will last, but for a small-to-middlin' property this should be plenty. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very slow trimming process. I purchased these to use to trim around our shop buildings but it really can't keep up. It works, but the power is much less than I had anticipated. I will keep it as a back up but I need to order a more powerful unit for efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B

customer_reviews.title: Actually a 4.5
customer_reviews.text: I had owned a B&D lithium ion string trimmer for many years before it just stopped a couple of months ago (just got tired I guess) and I loved it. That trimmer is a definite 5 star trimmer especially with a 5 ah battery on board. This trimmer works fine with the exception of the lock button which enables the on/off switch. It is a bit fussy...hence the 4.5 star rating. Also, the 3 ah battery works well and with good power but is not compatible with my older chargers. It requires the charger that comes with the trimmer. I just hope this trimmer lasts as long as my last one.
customer_reviews.author: JOFFRE R LEVESQUE

customer_reviews.title: Lasting power
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Black and Decker cordless. The first one I had the battery didn't last very long so I had extra ones available which I had to change about half way through the job. Then a spring broke which controls the auto feed and I was unable to find one to replace it. So I bought this one and the batttery is much better because it seems to give more power and lasts until i'm finished. Now I bought another Black and Decker because I had all these extra batteries. i'm just hoping the spring doesn't give out on this one as well. That's why only gave it a four star rating.
customer_reviews.author: John J. White

customer_reviews.title: No.  Good
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 10 feet edging. Needed more line it wouldn’t advance. So useless machine. Line is too thin. So don’t last very long. Save your money. And hassle of returning.
customer_reviews.author: larry weaver

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery powered weeder
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Money well spent. I had a gas pull string and i'm a fairly strong woman and it just got to ridiculous trying to turn the stupid thing on. this works just as well as far as weed eating if not better, and it's 1000% easier to turn on and utilize. battery lasts forever between charges, cuts through all types of grass. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little machine.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the big heavy machines cut a lot faster. But that's not the point. This is light and handy. It cuts grass just fine. If you want to trim around your sidewalk, your flowers (this is easy to control, won't torque hard, and you'll accidentally destroy a lot less flowers) , and nip errant grass without a lot of work, this is the machine you need. You can cut a LOT of grass with two batteries, and you will not be exhausted when you finish. When line runs out, simply change the cartridge. If you need to cut a football field of big tough weeds this isn't your machine. Then again, it was not designed to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only using a month.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a while. Started stopping on it's own but would restart. Now it finally stopped & won't start at all. Have only had it since May but did not take it out of box until about 4 weeks ago. A total waster of my money & now I can't send it back as it is past the 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Flaugh

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first day of use,smoking bad
customer_reviews.text: I only used it maybe 20 minutes,and could smell burning. I changed the battery because it wouldn't stay running. Tried using again and started smoking from the bottom and from the handle where the trigger is. I let it cool down and tried again but now it doesn't work at all. Total bummer I have tons to weed eat and my last black and Decker lst420 was awesome. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mowery

customer_reviews.title: Easyfeed is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Although the trimmer is pretty decent the Easyfeed doesn't work. I tried rewinding the spool - what a pain in the a**. Every time I try to rewind it and get it tight it springs back out immediately when I release it in order to reinsert the spool into the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Marcpent

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and works great (but bring extra batteries!)
customer_reviews.text: For context, I have approximately 3/4 of an acre with a fenced in back yard in Florida with thick grass. This works amazingly well at edging and trimming and is so lightweight and easy to use. We do tend to go through the extended battery and 1 or 2 smaller batteries to do the full yard, so definitely invest in a couple spares (For me this isn't a big deal, I use all B&D 20V tools so I have a stockpile of charged batteries ready to go). All-in-all, I'm extremely happy with this purchase and prefer it over any gas-powered tool I've used previously.
customer_reviews.author: Taegost

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer and wheeled edger
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight string trimmer/edger with a long battery life. I was replacing a gas dual string trimmer with heavy gauge line. When this arrived I was shocked to see a thin single line. Works very well though. Converts easily from trimmer to wheeled edger. Safety switch is cumbersome because you have to push the button and then hit the power button.
customer_reviews.author: william t norton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic string trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a corded trimmer because I didn't have faith in the battery powered kind, but I fell behind the times and regret not getting one of these sooner. The battery lasts about 40 minutes on the lower power, and doesn't lose power as it drains, it just stops, so none of that trying to do 'just a few more' feet'. You can leave the battery on the charger without damage between uses so it's always at the ready. Spool lasted me close to a year before I had to buy more so no complaints there either.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty small yard and not a demanding job for trimming....short front sidewalk area...small flagstone wall in the back yard...and a few items to trim around. It does a great job edging my sidewalk and driveway with the quick flip of the handle. Lithium battery snaps on quickly...trimline cartridges are easy to pop in, within seconds. The unit is very light weight and well balanced. I can't comment on the battery life. It only takes me about 10-12 minutes to do my whole yard, after mowing and then I place the battery back in the charger for next week. :) Can't go wrong with Black and Decker!!
customer_reviews.author: indianscoach

customer_reviews.title: This string trimmer/edger works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely pleased with this purchase. This string trimmer/edger works perfectly. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who recently purchased a home and is acquiring lawn equipment. When I pulled the trimmer out of the box, I expected to have to put the spool in myself but it was already feed. When finishing weed whacking, I was able to easily rotate the base into the edger position and completed my entire driveway/walkway in a matter of minutes. The battery only had a half charge when removed from the box, so I did have to fully charge the battery before operating.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew_O

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TRIMMER
customer_reviews.text: My old BD trimmer was a 12v and the battery would only do about 1/3 of my small yard on a 6-8 hour charge. Got this one hoping it would last longer. Totally impressed. I can do all of my yard on a charge and recharge in 2-3 hours. The short recharge means I did not drain the battery. The large battery in the device also means stronger cutting ability. Exceeds all of expectations.
customer_reviews.author: ACA327

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weed wacker basically because it runs off of a battery and I don't have to worry about dragging an electrical cord around the yard with me which is nothing but a pain in the you-know-what and the battery never failed me and I have a pretty big yard and it comes with its own charger so when you're not out in the yard using your weed wacker I can easily store in a small area to charge the battery so when you do need it very convenient worth the money and I would definitely purchase this product
customer_reviews.author: airforce

customer_reviews.title: My yard has never looked better!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I’ve ever made from Amazon! It is lightweight and it does the job. I am a woman and I can’t handle the big heavy gas powered weedeaters, this one edges my sidewalks and makes them look professionally done and the weedeater works perfectly. Also the string is easy to replace. Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: LindaT

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned up and began smoking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in November 2017 and it’s burned up in June 2018. I used it 2 times per month on average. The machine was smoking with an awful smell. I recommend you buy a warranty or get another brand. It was lightweight which is why I wanted it. It had great reviews too. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! It lasted 3 Months!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in late April it is now 3 Aug, used it about 6 times. Last week, the mechanism that holds the whipper broke so the husband decided to drill a wire through the handle to attach the line. No problem. Yesterday the battery died. And I mean died. It was giving us the endless red blinks of death. According to the manual, that means it won't hold the charge any more. 3 MONTHS! That's all my $90 plus my prime, plus the fact they don't deliver anything in 2 days any more, is worth. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Love this Weedwacker/Edger!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted an edger, but didn't want to pay the hefty price tag for a garden tool that only did one thing. When I looked at this Black and Decker, I was a little confused about how well it would edge until I got it home. It is wonderful, lightweight and yet digs a nice "trench" to really dress up your lawn. The weedwacker works well also. And the automatic feed for the line is just so easy. How did I ever do without this. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Roe

customer_reviews.title: Trim, edge, or anything between
customer_reviews.text: This device was purchased to maintain the walks and grounds at a small, suburban church. I bought a spare battery to make sure I could do the entire job of edging and trimming without needing to wait to recharge a battery. I had no worries, and completed the initial edging and trimming using only about one-quarter of the power in one battery. The option of turning the handle 180 degrees with respect to the cutter head is very useful. It is more powerful than other battery-powered trimmers I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like this trimmer. My husband bought it, but it is so easy to use I enjoy using it. Light weight, easy to start. I charged the battery and used it almost non-stop for 30 minutes and the battery was not dead yet. I don't know how long the battery lasts. It does a nice job cutting weeds around the house. It took a little time and effort cutting the really thick and tall grass but it did a nice job.. The line advances with the push of the button. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: No power - Horrible Performance
customer_reviews.text: After my B&D Grasshog belt/wheel melted (and couldn’t get a replacement wheel) and couldn’t order another Grasshog (disappointing since it worked well!). I ordered this battery powered B&D edger. Edger looks great and functionally moving it, rotating horizontal and vertical is smooth and works well. The performance however is HORRENDOUS. Don’t bother with this edger. I use it on a small yard with basic blades of grass (NOT using it for big weeds or thicker St Augustine grass) and I had to go over it back and for 2-3 times to get this to cut. Very weak, zero power and doesn’t get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Sam I Am

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to spend more money on a cordless but I am more than satisfied with this product. I am impressed by the battery life. Cut a corner lot and had a bit of juice left to cut the backyard but had to use another battery to complete it. It probably could have done the whole yard. I am impressed by the efficiency and it just handles better than my other black and decker trimmer. Highly recommended after using it twice. I'll update my review if anything should change.
customer_reviews.author: avidbookreader

customer_reviews.title: Decent Power, Lasts Reasonable Length Of Time On One Battery
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it's not quite as easy to operate as its 18 volt version with the automatic string dispenser. It's button-controlled cord release might be an improvement on the classic "bump" style, but it's rather awkward to use and sometimes you can end up without string and having to dig it out of the spool - something the automatic dispenser never permitted to happen. Other than that, it's your basic BD nicely ergonomic weedeater.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: No gas and oil !!
customer_reviews.text: I have a variety of Black and Decker products and they all use the same battery , I have only used it twice but i am very happy with the power and quality, and edger does great , you can roll it against a fence or wall and it will trim just great!! I used it about a total of two hours and i still have plenty of string left , so far very pleased......
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Does the job...and very well.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this a few weeks and it does everything I want it to do. The #1 setting does the light stuff ( But always follow directions and go from the top down to avoid tangling). The #2 setting has some nice power for heavier jobs. The first time I charged it it took about 7 hours. I almost bought a second battery and bigger charger, but I discovered I didn’t need them. After the battery was fully charged the first time, it only took 45 minutes to recharge this powerful battery. I was worried about the single line, but it is not a problem. It does fine. Very light and maneuverable. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Prof A. G. Talarico

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for One Year
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get through one refill spool of string before the bearing that holds the head in place melted through the casing. Would have been able to prevent it if the head was removable so you could clean out anything tangled around it easily. As it is, if anything tangles around the head, it will slowly eat away at the casing until the bearing and head push out and disengage from the motor gear. I'll look for something with a removable head now.
customer_reviews.author: John Larriva

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer has some nice features, like the adjustable length and the ability to rotate the cutting head. The string feed button is a not really what I thought it would be. The button really just stops the motor and when the motor stops the line feeds. So every time you stop trimming, the line feeds. I don’t really care for that feature as I’m guessing I will go through a lot of line. Also, the lower power setting is pretty weak. I just run it in the high power setting all the time.
customer_reviews.author: EInvestor

customer_reviews.title: I did not keep it.
customer_reviews.text: If you require a very light duty unit and so not mind walking sideways for edging, then I guess it's OK. For my use, with a good amount of edging around my pool and other concrete, I find it to be more of a "dangerous toy."
customer_reviews.author: Craig S.

customer_reviews.title: Battery powered trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer works fine and and performs as advertised. Battery life is good and the light weight portability is nice. However it is not the right tool for my needs which are unique. It would be fine for you're average home yard in the suburbs. However it is not the correct tool for multiple acres in a rain forest growth environment such as my property. Again I would like to emphasize that it is a quality tool for the appropriate applications.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this weed eater/edger. My last one (Ryobi) had an auto-feed system that didn't work well and eventually stopped working and I couldn't take it any more. I like that this one had a manual feed button. It works like a charm. I opted for the larger batter (instead of 2 smaller ones) which has never run out on our medium-sized property. I use it to edge and weed eat the the whole yard and it works really well. I use the high power settings which has no issue ripping through our thick St. Augustine grass.
customer_reviews.author: Random Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Good for my use
customer_reviews.text: If coming from a gas powered, note that this is much less powerful, but it's fine for trimming/edging your average lawn. I have 1/4 acre lots of flower beds, and fences and battery gets through it (maybe 45 min. to an hour) without an issue. If you high, weedy, overgrown areas or a lot of area it may not be strong enough but for me, I'm happy with it, it's super light weight, has the little wheel to make edging easy, and switches back and forth from edging to trimming easily.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tolliver

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed At All
customer_reviews.text: Well I let my time run out to return this toy. That is how I will describe it.I purchased the Big battery with this weed wacker and it lasts about 15 min before I can tell a power Drop. I probably weed eat a total 30 min of light work around pool and sidwalk
customer_reviews.author: donald d.

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty. Not for big yards.
customer_reviews.text: We have a .5 acre yard with a fence that needs weed eating on both sides. This does not last that job and is not heavy duty enough for really get the tall thick grass and weeds. Wish we could return but missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: My husband actually looks forward to trimming and edging now
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, quiet, and clean. The wheel makes edging a cinch. The line feed alone is worth the price. The only "con" is the battery life, which is about an hour. That's enough to do our backyard, and, in this heat, he shouldn't be out there for more than an hour, anyway. We'll probably buy a second battery at some point, if we don't upgrade the blower to cordless. We don't suggest getting a bigger battery, because of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I love not having to drag a cord around behind me. I have 1/3 acre and use this device mostly for trimming around the flower beds, the shrubs/trees and the perimeter along the fences. I was worried that the battery would not last long enough to finish the yard but it has never run out of power before I finish, which is usually around 30-40 minutes. The line feed works flawlessly, as opposed to the "bump on the ground" line feed of the old trimmer (which didn't work at all). Well balanced and (for me) very light. I find myself trimming much more often than I did before just because it is now so easy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: The new battery format lasts much longer
customer_reviews.text: I was annoyed when my old trimmer died and I discovered that they changed the battery format. I had 3 chargers and 5 batteries that were suddenly useless. I figured I'd have to invest in a bunch of batteries again. But it turns out that the new battery format lasts way longer. I can trim with the one battery what used to take 3 or 4 of the old batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Carl F. Green

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient, light weight cordless trimmer/edger for the yard and garden
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this cordless string trimmer years ago. It is light weight compared to a gas trimmer and more convenient than a corded electric trimmer. It is extremely easy to adjust between trimming and edging modes, and I love that I just need to push a button to feed more string. I used to dread edging and trimming after I cut the lawn, but now it is the easiest part of the job. No more gas and no more 100+ft extension cords!
customer_reviews.author: Norman D. Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (just snap on the guard and screw it tight), easy to charge, and easy to operate, but I agree with the reviewers who are saying that the string is a little skimpy and doesn't always do the job. If you know you're not going to do heavy-duty jobs and want a convenient cordless trimmer, it's fine. Otherwise, you'll want something stronger. The instructions are needlessly complicated. It's not a complicated tool.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for routine weed eating edging
customer_reviews.text: I’m taller (6’2”) so I do have to hunch over a bit to use this. That being said, this has plenty of power to do routine weed eating and edging, it’s lightweight and I prefer the battery application. The edger works really well, but it does seem to go through line a lot quicker when I’m edging mode. About 35 bucks cheaper the. The big box stores and I would buy again. If you are taking on serious weeds or trying to clear brush, probably not for you! I get about 35 minutes on high power and 45-50 if on low power.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic only for very lite duty
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd try it as my Stihl gas (that I have had and worked hard for 14 years now) is just to big for my wife to handle. This is the worst weedeater. Battery doesn't last, eats string like crazy, made of very beakable plastic and doesn't do very well on anything thick or over 2" tall. Can't see this thing lasting even one summer at our house. If you have a postage stamp size yard with very little weedeating to do this might work for you. The edger ?????
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the set -- the trimmer with the extra battery -- and I've been weed whacking my little heart out since it arrived! This thing is a beast and I love it! Using the more powerful speed I'm getting about 40 minutes out of each battery and that's with some thick, high grass mixed into the areas I've trimmed. I'm completely satisfied and more than pleased! Moreover, thank you folks who took the time to answer a question I had before making the purchase. What a great community!
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Fritch

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs and exactly what I wanted! Light weight and well balanced. Quick and easy assembly right out of the box. String is easy to advance using the button on the handle. I didn't rate the battery life because it arrived charged. I haven't had to recharge the battery yet. And, I didn't rate the string spool because I haven't had to change the string spool yet. Still using the one that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine and value
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my gas powered trimmer with this new battery model and I'm very pleased. The 20 v battery lasts well beyond my needs for trimming around my 1.6 acre lot. The trimmer has plenty of power to cut larger weeds and I really like push button auto line feed button, right near the top handle. The trimmer is light weight, easy to store and recharges quickly. No need to mix and store gasoline, no spillage or visits to the gas station. I'll be replacing a gas leaf blower and chainsaw soon, and I'll have a close look at battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Jim

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, adjustable height, good battery life. Does the job really well!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 65 year old woman standing 5 ft tall and I needed a weed whacker to trim a small patch of weeds and grass. This was easy to put together (only needed to attach one part) and is easy to use. It has a lot of power for a little guy. Some other women have complained that their trimmers did not have an adjustable height feature. I think that's imperative. The price was very reasonable. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy G

customer_reviews.title: I just love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I watched a You Tube video for operation and how to change the string. Very helpful. Light weight and gets the job done. I just have the one battery I did this to limit myself and not physically over due it. If you are able to do a large yard order the second battery.
customer_reviews.author: Craftmarm

customer_reviews.title: This is very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to use the big trimmer in the past, but it is gas powered and seemed hard to start and keep running. This one is so simple; just push the button and go. It's lightweight and I like the wheel that helps me edge the sidewalk. It might not be for everyone, but I only use it for 10-15 minutes at a time. They battery has had sufficient life for my weeding sessions with no issues. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Powell

customer_reviews.title: Internal thimble assembly jams  with grass and melts nylon gears in this copy also
customer_reviews.text: This is the second copy of B & D string trimmer that failed because grass gets into the thimble assembly and jams and melts the gears. It requires complete disassembly to clean out the thimble assembly before gears melt. I can send closeup photos.
customer_reviews.author: billybobjosephine

customer_reviews.title: The most basic...
customer_reviews.text: Of basic weeders. It works. But it's problematic at best. The guide tends to catch and bind against edges when using. The wire feeder is finicky at best and usually feeds more line than necessary. Battery life is ok but not what I expected. Honestly, I wouldn't buy this again especially since it's batteries aren't actually compatible with my other B&D battery operated lawn tools.
customer_reviews.author: Skipster

customer_reviews.title: Great value and a solid trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale which definitely ups the value factor, but the 3Ah battery works nicely for handling both the front and back yards with enough juice left over to run the blower too. The trimmer works great and the easy auto-feed line functions well too. There is a bit of a learning curve on edging, without a wire guide it takes some getting used to, but it edges well also once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteManBlackHips

customer_reviews.title: Not being tethered to an electrical outlet is crazy!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love it! The ability to carry it around the yard without being tethered to an electrical outlet is amazing. It did a beautiful job as an edger and the included battery easily lasted long enough for me to take care of my entire property. Compared to my older model, this one is deceptively light and was very easy to maneuver. I love the button that releases more of the cord. It's so much better than "bumping' the device which is what I had to do again with my older model. The power of this unit is also perfect for its use. There is no noticeable difference between this and its electrical counterpart. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Martorano

customer_reviews.title: Best Choice Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves it. Charging is easy and not an issue. Battery life is plenty for our yard. He has not had any issues with battery life, power, or charging. It’s easy to use. Definitely recommend it. There are several great technical reviews on this product. I read all of those prior to my purchase and glad I did. This is definitely the best choice for this style of trimmer in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER LSTE523 Li-On String Trimmer
product_meta.description: Style:20V String Trimmer KitEasy feed string trimmer is designed for trimming areas of overgrowth, & edging along borders, sidewalks, & flower beds. Features power drive transmission which increases torque & 2-speed control to choose between more power or extended run time. Easily converts from trimmer to wheeled edger. Easy feed advances the line with the push of a button, No bumping required. Adjustable height & handle with micro texture Soft grip. Includes: 20V Max extended run time lithium battery, charger, AFS Spool, & guard. This product is Manufactured in China. This product meets customer requirement.
feature_bullets: Converts from trimmer to wheeled edger; Line diameter 0.065 inch
Power drive transmission for increased torque
2 speed control for more power or extended runtime. Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 volts. Nominal voltage is 18
Easy feed allows you to advance your line with the push of a button with no bumping required
Part of the 20 Volt MAX System; 1 system endless tasks. Power for your style

Part of the POWERCOMMAND Family of tools EASYFEED, POWERCUT, POWERBOOST helps solve common user frustrations when using outdoor power equipment. Included components: (1) LSTE523 20V MAX* Cordless Trimmer/Edger, (1) LB2X3020 20V MAX* Extended runtime Lithium Battery, (1) Charger, (1) AFS Spool, (1) Guard

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,562 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
